availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac J. Black (Knox County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John C. Black and Clarissa Black. Married to Mildred Black. Father of John Black, Meala Black, and David. Black. Laborer in Knox County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Knox County in 1860. Served in the 49th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st Lieutenant from July 18, 1963 to December 14, 1863. Served in the 49th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Captain from December 14, 1863 to .

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, p. 389A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Payne, p. 69.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p.501.
Find A Grave, "Isaac Jones Black (Aug 5, 1828-Oct 22, 1866)," Memorial #57887163, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/57887163 (accessed June 27, 2020).
